section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter governs the procedures for obtaining a declaratory ruling from the EMS Board.

para.text: In this chapter, the following term has the meaning indicated.

Term Defined. "Declaratory ruling" means a ruling made by a promulgating authority with respect to the manner in which the promulgating authority would apply a regulation or order of the promulgating authority, or a statute that the promulgating authority enforces, to a person or a property based on a given set of facts.
A person may file a petition for a declaratory ruling by the EMS Board by delivering a copy of the petition to the Executive Director of MIEMSS.
The petition for a declaratory ruling shall:
The interest of the person making the request,
A list of documents or statements which should be considered, and
A statement under the penalties of perjury by the person requesting the ruling that the facts contained in the petition are true.
Consider the petition and may issue the declaratory ruling requested; and
Notify the person seeking the ruling in writing of the:
The EMS Board shall keep a record of each declaratory ruling issued, indexed by reference to statutes or regulations involved.
The EMS Board may publish and allow inspection of declaratory rulings of general interest subject to the requirements of law.

section.heading: Appeal.
section.text: A declaratory ruling is subject to judicial review under State Government Article, §10-305, Annotated Code of Maryland. The EMS Board shall be a party to any judicial review.
